channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9874] Append and Increment operation drops Tags
item.description: We should consider tags in the existing cells as well as tags coming in the cells within Increment/Append
item.summary: Append and Increment operation drops Tags

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Working with it. Will post a patch soon.
Oh.. It did not get added in the Tags patch I think.

2 problems here.
1. Cells with tags added to Append/Increment is not passing those tags to server
2. When we do a put with some tags in it and later do an increment or append on this, we create new cells at server side. At that time we should not drop the existing tags for the cell. We should consider tags in old cell as well as cells coming in the Increment/Append.
Is there a concept for "merging" tags existing in the cell + those from the new mutation? (please pardon my ignorance)

In case of Append/Increment we are actually merging an existing cell with an incoming cell and making a new cell right. So there the tags can be present in old cell and/or incoming cell and I am thinking that in the new resultant cell all tags should be added. Right now we are not even considering the existing tags in old cell. What do you say ramkrishna.s.vasudevan , Andrew Purtell ?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12611674/HBASE-9874.patch
against trunk revision .

This message is automatically generated.

In the cell ACL patch I add a CP hook for deciding what to do and handle this for cell ACLs.

Let's extract that hook and add it here.

An increment can actually add up multiple cells, so a naive merge may produce a resulting cell with several duplicate tags (or even tags with internal details that conflict). No problem to do the naive thing by default and just carry all tags found attached to the old cell(s) forward onto the new one. But then give a CP a chance to optionally clean up the result.

Also, for cell ACLs, sometimes we don't want to carry old tags forward - if the operation has a new ACL specified for the result. So again we need a hook to override default behavior.

Yes Andy doing a naive merge now. Taking the tags from old cell and the corresponding cell's tags in Increment/Append. Merge all into the resultant new cell. Then we can give chance to CP. It is like there can be a ACL tag in old cell and new ACL tag in the corresponding cell comin in Append/Increment. The core will just merge both into the new cell. Then the CP hook can decide what to do with these 2. (Which one should go finally).. Doing exactly same in the visibility labels patch. Pls review patch V2
I reviewed patch V2. I don't like it. It's missing the CP hook. It will do a naive merge no matter what a CP might want to do, possibly duplicating work.

The naive merge is fine Anoop Sam John but let's put the postMutationBeforeWAL hook in on this JIRA.

Attaching the postMutationBeforeWAL code from the AccessController as an example user of this hook, in case someone wants to take a look here.

Unfortunately I don't see how today each CP in a chain doing some rewriting of its tag data can avoid allocating a new KV and copying over all other tags - not until we have something like HBASE-9794. We are going to be duplicating the work of the naive merge anyhow (and the naive merge is fine in the general case.)

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12611792/AccessController.postMutationBeforeWAL.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7716//console

This message is automatically generated.

but let's put the postMutationBeforeWAL hook in on this JIRA

Sure. Can put the hook also in this Jira. Initially I thought that will be covered as part of HBASE-7662 or some other sub task.

We are going to be duplicating the work of the naive merge anyhow

Yes agree. But we are not sure whether there will be some CP impls available to do this merge. In general when user adds some other tags and do increment of the cell, we should not drop the tags in new cell. That is why I raised this Jira.. I think you are agreeing here too...

Next Patch I will put the CP hook also. Thanks Andy for the review.
Patch V3 including the CP hook also

I had a similar impl in my old patches. Patch looks good. YEs if the CP needs control on what to be done then we need the hook alone, but cannot depend on the CP always here.
+1 on patch V3
Committed to Trunk. Thanks for the reviews.

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
During Append/Increment operation, new cells will carry tags from old cell as well as tags passed in the cells in Append/Increment.
A new CP hook is provided which will be called after the new cell is created and before it is getting written to memstore/WAL. A user can use this hook to possibly change the new cell. The above naive merge of tags may result in duplicates. This hook can decide which all tags should go in finally.
